intro: Nicotiana goodspeedii, commonly known as Goodspeed's tobacco, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Nicotiana goodspeedii is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and unique coloration.
